awd_titl_txt: Assembly of Complex III of the Yeast Respiratory Chain
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal addresses the interactions between nuclearly and                  mitochondrially encoded proteins by study of the function of a                  novel protein--localized in yeast mitochrondria--that is essential              for complex III of the electron transport chain.  This nuclearly                encoded protein (CBP4) is not a component of the respiratory chain              but is essential for an active enzyme complex in vivo.  The effects             of this protein on the import into the mitochrondrion of complex                III subunits, more rapid turnover of the subunits, subunit-binding              to CBP4, and the relative kinetics of CBP4 and complex III subunit              syntheses during de novo protein synthesis will be among the foci               of the research.  Use of a suppressor mutant strain should aid the              analyses of the functional role of CBP4 and/or other proteins that              may be shown to have a role in regulation of respiratory function.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, THE
